main event: A colonel reported observation of a bright white ball, larger than a basketball, at 2,200 feet in Vaughn, New Mexico on November 17, 1948.
interesting points: The ball was observed for 2 minutes before disappearing., The object was bright white and stationary at approximately 290 feet., The object's altitude was noted to be between 400-500 feet., A companion suggested moving to avoid potential danger., The report contains vague details of previous observations by the same colonel in early November.
